titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. John Nelson, William Nelson, and Dorcas Nelson, Judgment
CWG11427

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Commonwealth
vs } charge assault and Battery on J Gilliland verdict and Judgment
John Nelson. William and Dorcan Nelson

This day came the Parties and a Jury being summoned, thereupon, came a Jury viz. L. D. Wright Wm D Evans, Walker Elder, James Harris, J. P. Frederick, Saml Brougman, George Hall, Wm Wood, L. Y Melone, ^James Melone Sr^ N Shouse and R. R. Clarke, who being sworn, well and truly to try the issue, and a true verdict render and having heard the evidence returned the following verdict we the Jury find the defendent John Nelson Guilty and assess his fine at twenty dollars or ten days imprisonment and costs, we also find William and Dorcas Nelson Guilty and assess their fine at one cent each, and costs
June the 18th 1862 John P Frederick Foreman

it is therefore adjudged by the Court that the defendant John Nelson make good his fine to the Commonwealth, by the payment of twenty dollars and that he be imprisoned in the Jail of Jefferson County until the same be paid not to exceed ten days, that being one day for each two dollars of said fine, and ^that^ William Nelson and Dorcas Nelson also make good their fine of one cent each to the said Commonwealth and that they pay the costs of this prosecution

T. J. Conner J P J C
June 18th 1862

I Thomas J Conner Justice of the Peace for Jefferson County do certify that the within is a true copy of the Judgment rendered in my Court, in the case of the Commonwealth versus John, William and Dorcas Nelson on the 18th day of June 1862 and a correct statement of the amount of costs, as appears of record upon my docket
Given under my hand this 25th day of June 1862
T. J. Conner J. P. J. C.

Com'th
vs } Judgment
John William & Dorcas Nelson
